data.name: AppUser_Description
data.value: Represents the primary user account in LagoVista applications, used for authentication, authorization, and managing user profile details based on ASP.NET Identity.

data.name: AppUser_Help
data.value: Core user account model for LagoVista applications built on ASP.NET Identity.

data.name: AppUser_PasswordConfirmPasswordMatch
data.value: Password and Confirm Password should match.

data.name: GeoLocation_Description
data.value: The Geo Location Model is used to provide a class that will store latitude, longitude

data.name: GeoLocation_Help
data.value: The Geo Location Model is used to provide a class that will store latitude, longitude

data.name: ImageDetails_Description
data.value: Contains meta data necessary to display an image.

data.name: ImageDetails_Help
data.value: Contains meta data necessary to display an image.

data.name: Invitation_Description
data.value: Create, send, and track invitations for people to join an organization.

data.name: Invitation_Help
data.value: Stores and manages invitations sent to people to join an organization.

data.name: InviteUser_AlreadyPartOfOrg
data.value: The user [USERS_FULL_NAME] with an email address of [EMAIL_ADDRESS] already belongs to this organization.

data.name: InviteUser_ClickHere
data.value:
To accept the invitation and begin using the platform, please click open in browser.

Or copy and paste the link below into the address bar of your browser

[ACCEPT_LINK]

data.name: InviteUser_Greeting_Message
data.comment: WIll replace [USERS_FULL_NAME] with the first/last name of current user, [ORG_NAME] as the name of the organization.

data.name: LocationUserRole_Description
data.value: Assign and manage user roles for specific locations. A user can have different roles depending on where they work within the organization.

data.name: LocationUserRole_Help
data.value: Defines user roles that are scoped to specific locations, allowing a user to have different roles at each location.

data.name: LocationUser_Description
data.value: Use locations to link devices and application users to specific places in your organization.

data.name: LocationUser_Help
data.value: Links an application user to a specific location within the organization.

data.name: LocationNamespace_Help
data.value: The location namespace is used when adding a device to a specific location in conjunction with the organizatoin namespace to generate a unique human readable device id. The namespaces must be unique across your organization. Namespace can only contain lower case letters and number with no spaces or special characters other than dash or [-]

data.name: OrganizationUserRole_Description
data.value: The Organization User Roles Structures defines which roles the user hold in a particular organization.

data.name: OrganizationUserRole_Help
data.value: The Organization User Roles Structures defines which roles the user hold in a particular organization.

data.name: OrganizationUser_CouldntAdd
data.value: Could not add user to organization

data.name: OrganizationUser_UserExists
data.value: [USERS_FULL_NAME] is already part of [ORG_NAME], they can't be added twice.

data.name: OrganizationLocation_NamespaceInUse
data.value: This name space is alredy in use for your organization, please select a new one.

data.name: OrganizationNamespace_Help
data.value: The organizationn namespace is used to generated unique device ids for your organization. It must be unique within our system or your installation. Namespace can only contain lower case letters and number with no spaces or special characters other than dash or [-]

data.name: Organization_User_Description
data.value: The Organization User Relationship table is used to map users to an organization.

data.name: Organization_User_Help
data.value: The Organization User Relationship table is used to map users to an organization.

data.name: Organization_Description
data.value: Use an organization to group related users, locations, devices, configurations, and data into a single container.

data.name: Organization_Help
data.value: A container for grouping users, locations, devices, configurations, and related data or functionality.

data.name: Organization_Location_Description
data.value: Create and manage locations within an organization to group related resources and simplify administration.

data.name: Organization_Location_Help
data.value: Locations within an organization used to group and manage related resources.

data.name: Organization_NamespaceInUse
data.value: A unique namespace is required. You have entered a namespace that is already in use, please enter a new namespace.

data.name: Role_Description
data.value: Assign this role to users to manage which features and areas of the system they can access.

data.name: Role_Help
data.value: Create and manage roles that control user access to specific features and areas of the system.

data.name: AcceptInviteVM_Description
data.value: Use this page to accept your invitation by signing in with an existing account or registering a new one.

data.name: AcceptInviteVM_Help
data.value: Log in if you already have an account, or create a new account to accept your invitation.

data.name: ChangePasswordVM_Description
data.value: Enter your current password, then enter and confirm your new password to update it.

data.name: ChangePasswordVM_Help
data.value: Change your password by providing your current password and a new one.

data.name: CreateLocationVM_Description
data.value: Allows the user to create new locations.

data.name: CreateLocationVM_Help
data.value: Your organization can contain multiple locations, you can add those here.

data.name: CreateOrganizationVM_Description
data.value: Create a new organization as a container for your related resources. You can optionally include starter data to help you get started.

data.name: CreateOrganizationVM_Help
data.value: Enter the details needed to create your new organization.

data.name: ExternalLoginConfirmVM_Description
data.value: Review and confirm your external account details, including your email address, to finish signing in.

data.name: ExternalLoginConfirmVM_Help
data.value: Confirm and link your external account to complete sign-in.

data.name: ForgotPasswordVM_Description
data.value: Enter the email address associated with your account. If it matches an existing account, we’ll email you a link to reset your password.

data.name: ForgotPasswordVM_Help
data.value: Enter the email address associated with your account. If it matches an existing account, we’ll email you a link to reset your password.

data.name: IndexVM_Description
data.value: Use this page to review your account details and manage settings, including contact information, sign-in options, and security preferences.

data.name: IndexVM_Help
data.value: Review and update your account settings and preferences.

data.name: InviteUserVM_Description
data.value: Complete this form with the person’s name, email address, and an optional message to send them an invitation to join your organization.

data.name: InviteUserVM_Help
data.value: Invite someone to your organization by providing their contact details and an optional message.

data.name: InviteUserVM_Title
data.value: Invite a User to Your Organization

data.name: LocationVM_Description
data.value: A location is a structure that can be used to organize your devices. An organization can be a physical address, a room or even a conceptual entity.

data.name: LocationVM_Help
data.value: Represents a location used to organize devices, such as a physical address, room, or other defined area within your organization.

data.name: LoginVM_Description
data.value: Enter your email and password to sign in to your account. Select "Remember me" to stay signed in on this device.

data.name: LoginVM_Help
data.value: Sign in to securely access your account.

data.name: OrganizationDetailsVM_Description
data.value: Review and update your organization’s information.

data.name: OrganizationDetailVM_Help
data.value: View and manage your organization’s details.

data.name: OrganizationVM_Description
data.value: Displays key organization details in list views, including the name, namespace, and website.

data.name: OrganizationVM_Help
data.value: Provides a summary of each organization for use in list views.

data.name: RegisterVM_Description
data.value: Complete this form to create your account.

data.name: RegisterVM_Help
data.value: Create a new account by entering your details.

data.name: ResetPassword_Description
data.value: Use this form to reset your password and regain access to your account by entering your email address and creating a new password.

data.name: ResetPassword_Help
data.value: Restore access to your account by entering your email address and choosing a new password.

data.name: SendCodeVM_Description
data.value: Send a two-factor authentication code to a secondary device to verify your account.

data.name: SendCodeVM_Help
data.value: Send a two-factor authentication code to verify your account.

data.name: SetPasswordVM_Description
data.value: Set a new password of at least 6 characters to protect your account.

data.name: SetPasswordVM_Help
data.value: Create a new password with at least 6 characters.

data.name: UpdateLocationVM_Help
data.value: Update the details and settings for an existing location.

data.name: UpdateLocatoinVM_Description
data.value: Edit this location’s configuration, including its identifiers and contact information.

data.name: UpdateOrganizationVM_Description
data.value: Update the organization’s information, including key details such as locations and contacts.

data.name: VerifyCodeVM_Description
data.value: Enter the code from your chosen authentication method to complete two-factor verification. You may also choose to remember this device or browser for future sign-ins.

data.name: VerifyCodeVM_Help
data.value: Enter your two-factor authentication code to continue.

data.name: VerifyPhoneNumberVM_Description
data.value: Confirm your phone number, typically by entering the verification code that was sent to you.

data.name: VerifyPhoneNumberVM_Help
data.value: Verify your phone number to continue.

data.name: Common_Key_Help
data.value: The key is used to identify this item in scripts and must be unique with respect to it's parent. One a key has been assigned, it can not be changed.

data.name: Common_Key_Validation
data.value: The key must use only letters and numbers, and must be lowercase and must be between 3 and 20 characters.

data.name: Subscription_Description
data.value: A subscription is used to track usage of compute and storage resources used by your application, it is also associated with a payment method that will be billed as per terms.

data.name: Subscription_Help
data.value: Tracks your application’s compute and storage usage and the payment method billed according to your plan’s terms.

data.name: AssetSet_Description
data.value: Use Asset Sets to organize related assets and control which teams or users can access them. In a Restricted Asset Set, assigned assets are hidden by default until a team or user is granted access to the Asset Set.

data.name: AssetSet_Help
data.value: Groups related assets and manages which teams or users can access them.

data.name: AssetSet_IsRestricted_Help
data.value: If your Asset Set is Restricted any Assets that are assigned to this Asset Set are not available by default. To gain access to assets in a Restricted Asset Group the team or user must have access to the Asset Set.

data.name: Team_Description
data.value: Create and manage teams to control which users can perform specific tasks and access particular Asset Sets.

data.name: Team_Help
data.value: Organize people into teams to manage task permissions and access to Asset Sets.

data.name: AuthErr_InvalidGrantType
data.value: Invalid Grant Type, allowable grant types are password and refreshtoken

data.name: AuthErr_MissingAppInstanceid
data.value: App Instance Id is required for renewing an access token with a refresh token

data.name: AuthErr_MissingRefreshToken
data.value: Grant Type is refreshtoken but refresh token not provided

data.name: AuthErr_RefreshToken_InvalidFormat
data.value: The format of of the refresh token is not valid

data.name: AuthErr_RefreshToken_NotFound
data.value: Could not find supplied refresh token

data.name: AuthErr_RefreshTokenNotInStoraage
data.value: Attempt to retrieve refresh token from storage by id failed.

data.name: AuthErr_UserIsNullForRefresh
data.value: User is null, must pass in current user when requesting a refresh token grant

data.name: AuthErr_AuthRequestNull
data.value: Authentication Request is null, can not validate user

data.name: AuthErr_MissingDeviceId
data.value: Device ID is required for authorization

data.name: RegErr_ErrorSendingEmail
data.value: Error sending confirmation email, please check your address and try again.

data.name: RegErr_ErrorSendingPhoneNumber
data.value: Error sending SMS code to phone, please check your number and try again.

data.name: RegErr_MissingFirstName
data.value: Missing First Name for User Registration

data.name: RegErr_MissingLastName
data.value: Missing Last Name for User Registration

data.name: AuthErr_OrgNotAuthorized
data.value: Sorry, you are not authorized to switch to that organization.

data.name: AuthErr_ErrorUpdatingUser
data.value: System Error writing Change User Org to Database

data.name: AuthErr_UserLockedOut
data.value: Sorry, this account has been locked out. Please try again later or contact an administrator

data.name: Email_ResetPassword_Body
data.value:
You have requested to have your password reset.

Please Reset your Password by clicking this Reset Password link.

If you did not request your password to be changed, you can safely ignore this email.

data.name: Email_RestPassword_ErrorSending
data.value: Sorry, there was an error sending your reset password link, please try again later.

data.name: Email_Verification_Body
data.value:
Thank you for registering for access to NuvIoT.

To confirm your email address and complete the registration process, please click on this Confirm Email link or mobile link on your mobile phone or Windows App.

You can also copy the link below into the address bar of your browser.

[CALLBACK_URL]

data.name: Err_PwdChange_CouldNotFindUser
data.value: Could not find a user with that User Id

data.name: Err_PwdChange_UserId_Missing
data.value: You must pass in the Id (not user name) of the user that is requesting to change the password.

data.name: Err_ResetPwd_CouldNotFindUser
data.value: Sorry, we could not find a user with that email address.

data.name: Err_UserId_DoesNotMatch
data.value: Sorry, you can not change your password at this time. Please logout, then log back in to change your password.

data.name: SMS_CouldNotVerify
data.value: Sorry, the code you entered was not the code that was sent to the phone, please try again.

data.name: Err_PwdChange_MissingUserId
data.value: Missing User Id on Password Change Request

data.name: Err_PwdChange_UserIdMismatch
data.value: User ID Provided in Password Change Request does not Match Logged in User

data.name: Err_PwdReset_MissingNewPassword
data.value: Missing New Password on Reset Password Request

data.name: Err_PwdReset_MissingToken
data.value: Missing Token on Reset Password Request

data.name: Err_PwdReset_MssingEmail
data.value: Missing Email on Reset Password Request

data.name: ErrInvitation_AlreayAccepted
data.value: That invitation has already been accepted

data.name: ErrInvitation_CantFind
data.value: Sorry, we could not find that invitation

data.name: AuthErr_NotOrgAdmin
data.value: Sorry, you need to be an Organization Admin to Perform this Task.

data.name: AuthErr_CanNotRemoveSelfFromOrgAdmin
data.value: Sorry, you can not remove your self from the role of Org Admin

data.name: AuthErr_CurrentOrgAlreadySet
data.value: You are already logged in with this org and can not switch to itself.

data.name: RegErr_UserAlreadyExists
data.value: You have entered an email account that is already in use. Please log on to your existing account. If you have forgotten your password, you can reset it by clicking on the Forgot Password link. If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact support.

data.name: AuthErr_InviteNotActive
data.value: Sorry, this invitation is not available, you have already accepted it, or it has been revoked.

data.name: InviteErr_EmailInvalid
data.value: Email Address Is Invalid for Inviting a User.

data.name: InviteErr_EmailIsEmpty
data.value: Email is Required to Invite a User

data.name: InviteErr_NameIsRequired
data.value: Name is Required to Invite a User

data.name: ClientApp_Description
data.value: A client app is a thick/mobile/external application that will authenticate and access NuvIoT via REST

data.name: ClientApp_Help
data.value: A client app is a thick/mobile/external application that will authenticate and access NuvIoT via REST

data.name: RegisterUserExists_3rdParty
data.value: A user with that email account already exists please invite them to this organization.

data.name: Organization_CreateGettingStartedData_Help
data.value: When you create your organization it can be populated with a few objects that will help getting started a little easier.

data.name: DistroList_Description
data.value: Create and manage distribution lists to group users or email addresses that should receive notifications for specific events, such as devices going offline or exceeding configured thresholds. This helps ensure the right people are informed promptly and can act quickly.

data.name: DistroList_Help
data.value: Groups of users or email addresses that receive notifications when specific events occur, such as devices going offline or exceeding configured thresholds. Distribution lists support fast, targeted communication so the right people are notified and can respond quickly.

data.name: HolidaySet_Description
data.value: A Holiday Set is a predefined set of holidays for a specific culture. Use Holiday Sets to initialize downtime calendars for your organization.

data.name: HolidaySet_Help
data.value: Predefined sets of holidays for a specific culture, used to initialize organizational downtime calendars.

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_Description
data.value: Define a Scheduled Downtime Period to set up a recurring daily time window when equipment or processes are intentionally taken out of service.

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_End_Help
data.value: End time for the down tme period, must be number representing the time such as 1030 for 10:30 AM and 1415 for 2:15 PM

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_Help
data.value: A recurring daily time window when equipment or processes are planned to be unavailable.

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_Start_Help
data.value: Start time for the down time period, must be number representing the time such as 1030 for 10:30 AM and 1415 for 2:15 PM

data.name: ScheduledDowntime_Description
data.value: A planned period when systems, services, or devices are intentionally taken offline for maintenance, upgrades, or other planned activities. Configure scheduled downtime to suppress notifications when devices are offline or not sending messages during these times.

data.name: ScheduledDowntime_Help
data.value: A planned period when systems, services, or devices are intentionally taken offline for maintenance, upgrades, or other planned activities. Use scheduled downtime to suppress notifications when devices are offline or not sending messages during these periods.

data.name: ScheduledDowntime_ScheduleType_DayOfWeekOfWeekInMonth
data.value: Day of week, of week in month

data.name: Area_Help
data.value: Create an Area to organize related pages into a logical section of the user interface. If an Area does not contain any pages, you can use it to represent a single page instead.

data.name: Feature_Help
data.value: A feature is an element of a page to allow configuration of security.

data.name: Module_Help
data.value: Modules are top-level sections of the application. They appear in the main navigation and let users switch between different areas of the interface.

data.name: Page_Help
data.value: Features are aspects of a module, area or page that can be used in code to secure an activity or user interface component, they can also be used to render menus or a section of a user interface.

data.name: Module_RestrictByDefault_Help
data.value: If Restrict by Default is checked access to this resource will only be available to users with System Admin or users that have been granted access to this resource by role. If this is unchecked, any user will have access to this resource.

data.name: Menu_DoNotDisplay_Help
data.value: By default the rendering system automatically generates menus, if you need to manually render this, you can set to false.

data.name: AuthSingleuseToken_TokenNotFound
data.value: Token not found in single use token request.

data.name: AuthSingleuseToken_UserNotFound
data.value: UserId not found in single use token request

data.name: Calendar_ObjectDescription
data.value: Use this page to create and manage company events. Specify the event date, time, and relevant details so others can view and access the event information.

data.name: Organization_HomePage_Help
data.value: The home for users logging in to NuvIoT is the standard portal that shows all the modules within NuvIoT for a user. If you want to login to a different page, you can add the path here, the primary host name should still be https://www.nuviot.com though.

data.name: Organization_DefaultContributor_Help
data.value: The Default Contributor will be assigned to the project as the person who will be doing the work. If your team is larger this will likely be changed as part of the task planning process.

data.name: Organization_DefaultProjectAdminLead_Help
data.value: The Default Project Admin Lead will be assigned as the default person on the project to ensure that things continue moving on the project and will check in on thats that are past their due date.

data.name: Organization_DefaultProjectLead_Help
data.value: The Default Project Lead is the person that will be the defalt person that is assged that will responsible for executing the projects within your organization, this can be changed when creating your project. This default project lead is the default person that is assigned to a new task that ensure the work will get done, even though they may not complete it themselves.

data.name: Organization_DefaultQAResource_Help
data.value: The Default QA Resource will be assigned to the project and be responsible for ensuring work is completed and does not have any issues.

data.name: HelpResource_Description
data.value: A Help Resource is content, either a Guide or a Web Page link that let's the user know how to perform a task within NuvIoT.

data.name: ModuleCategory_Support_Summary
data.value: Modules to support your IoT application

data.name: ModuleCategory_Tools_Summary
data.value: Tools to build your IoT Applications

data.name: ModuleCateogry_EndUser_Summary
data.value: Modules that end users can use to work with data from your IoT application

data.name: UiCategory_Description
data.value: Use UI Categories to organize related launcher cards into logical groups in the user interface. Create, edit, and manage these categories to keep the launcher organized and easy to navigate.

data.name: Subscription_PaymentMethod_Help
data.value: Your credit card information is safe. Your card number is never sent to or stored on our servers, we use Stripe to handle our payment processing.

data.name: ModuleCategory_Admin_Summary
data.value: General Management and Settings for NuvIoT

data.name: ModuleCategory_IoT_Summary
data.value: Build and Manage your IoT Applications

data.name: AppUser_SSN_Help
data.value: Your Social Security Number is encrypted on the server. If you get an error message when attempting to view it, please make sure you are in your primary organization.

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_EndOfDay_Help
data.value: Select this option if thie scheduled down time should end at the end of the day (11:59 PM)

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_InvalidTimeFormat
data.value: Invalid Time Period, please specifiy a time with HHMM such as 1030 for 10:30 AM and 1530 for 3:30 PM

data.name: ScheduledDowntimePeriod_StartOfDay_Help
data.value: Select this option if thie scheduled down time should start at the start of the day (12:00 AM)

data.name: AuthenticationLogs_Description
data.value: View detailed information about each authentication event in NuvIoT.

data.name: LocationDiagrams_Description
data.value: Create and view location diagrams to visually represent and organize physical locations.

data.name: LocationDiagram_BaseLocation_Help
data.value: The Base Location is the top level location that hosts all the sub locations or rooms within this diagram.

data.name: LocationDiagram_Shape_Help
data.value: Create or edit a shape on the location diagram to represent a room or other object. You can adjust its size, position, rotation, and visual style as needed.

data.name: LocationDiagram_Shape_OrgLocation_Help
data.value: The location within the organization that this shape or room represents

data.name: LocationDiagramShapeGroup_Description
data.value: A group of shapes that are grouped together.

data.name: LocationDiagramLayer_Description
data.value: Create and manage layers to group related shapes in a diagram. Use layers to organize shapes, control their visibility, and manage them together.

data.name: LocationDiagramShapeGroup_Help
data.value: Group multiple shapes so they can be selected and edited together as a single unit.

data.name: Organization_SubLocation_Details
data.value: A Sub-Location is part of a location that has specific details.

data.name: DeviceOwnersDevices_Description
data.value: The devices that this owner is associated with.

data.name: DeviceOwner_Description
data.value: A Device Owner is a user in the system that ones one ore many devices across different organizations.

data.name: ExternalContact_Description
data.value: A person outside the system who is not a registered user but can receive notifications.

data.name: Organization_Logo_DarkColor_Help
data.value: Logo that will be used on a light color background, which may be the primary background color with an aspect ration of 3:1, a good size is 800x225

data.name: Organization_Logo_LightColor_Help
data.value: Logo that will be used on a dark color background such as a white page with an aspect ration of 3:1, a good size for this image is 800x225

data.name: OrgLocation_GeoBoundingBox_Help
data.value: A collection of points that make up a bounding box that define the perimeter of the location, if you are not using the built in editor, this field is a string that represents a JSON array of 2D or 3D points of latitude and longitude. There must be a minimum of three points.

data.name: AppUser_PrimaryOrganization_Help
data.value: The primary organization is the primary organization for the user. This is where their Social Security number is stored and is typically where they will get paid.

data.name: LocationDiagram_Shape_CustomerLocation_Help
data.value: Location within a customer that this shape presents

data.name: DistroList_ParentList_Help
data.value: A distribution list can have a parent list associated with it, this is commonly used for escalatoin.

data.name: Module_RootPath_Help
data.value: This is the root path where the module exists. It typically maps to a path as defined in Traefix (our K8s ingress mapper) that will map that path to a docker image that contains the user interface.

data.name: ContactList_Description
data.value: A list of contacts managed by a third-party email service that we can send email to. Currently uses SendGrid, with potential support for other services in the future.

data.name: Organization_AppUrl_Help
data.value: This is the URL that identifies how users will access resources and links. By default this will be https://www.nuviot.com

data.name: FunctionMap_Description
data.value: Use the Function Map to browse system functions and understand how they relate to each other. Access to this resource may be restricted based on your role, administrator settings, or specific access grants.

data.name: EmailSender_Description
data.value: An email sender is used to send emails to an external list of contacts.

data.name: Organization_TestingIndustry_Help
data.value: The testing industry is used to test out email templates, mailers and bulk email mailings. As part of the setup, you should upload a bulk email list that has a few sample contacts you can receive and review emails sent.

data.name: Organization_DefaultBusinessDevelopmentRep_Help
data.value: The employee that should be the default business development representative of the organization.

data.name: Organization_LandingPageHostName_Help
data.value: The landing page host name will be used by the web server to detect requests made with this host name. If the host name matches and there is no path a redirect will be done to the default landing page. The protocol such as HTTP:// or HTTPS:// should not be included.

data.name: SentEmail_Description
data.value: View detailed records of sent emails, including message content and delivery details when available.

data.name: Organization_DefaultTeamsWebHook_Help
data.value: Create a web hook to a channel within Microsoft Teams, as mentions are added to discussions, those discussions will be added to the channel and anyone tagged in the discussion will be notified.

data.name: Organization_DefaultIndustry_Help
data.value: The Default Industry is used when creating new customers when an industry is not selected. The industry can be changed at a later time for the customer.

data.name: Organization_EndUserHomePage_Help
data.value: This is the home page where end users, or people that are using your application should see when they login. This is different then the Home Page where standard users, typcially the ones that are budiling and manage the application will see when they login.

data.name: Organization_EmailConfirmSubject_Help
data.value: This is the subject line of the message the user will get when they are asked to confirm their email address for the organization. If one isn't provided it will display the message associated with NuvIoT.

data.name: Organization_EmailConfirmBody_Help
data.value: This is the body of the email message that will be sent to ask the user to confirm their account. If one is not provided, the standard message associated with NuvIoT will be used. This method should include some tags that will be replaced by links the user should click on, those links are [CALLBACK_URL] and [MOBILE_CALLBACK_URL].

data.name: Organization_DefaultAgentContext_Help
data.value: This is the default agent context that is used to connect to APTIX.

data.name: Organization_SupportEmailAddress_Help
data.value: Email address that can be used in documentation and web sites for support.

data.name: Organization_HrEmailAddress_Help
data.value: Email address that can be used to address human resources issues like hiring.

data.name: Organization_ArEmailAddress_Help
data.value: Email Address that should be used to contact accounts receivables, this is used on things like invoices.

data.name: Organization_ApEmailAddress_Help
data.value: Email address for accounts payable, can be used on things like purchase orders.

data.name: FunctionMapFunction_Description
data.value: Define a function on this page to control or secure specific behavior for users who can access it.

data.name: AuthView_Help
data.value: Authentication views are used to build UI integration tests for authentication

data.name: AuthView_Description
data.value: Authentication views are used to build UI integration tests for authentication

data.name: AuthView_RouteHelp
data.value: The actual route in the user inteface for this authentication view

data.name: AuthView_FormFiield_Description
data.value: A form field is an input on the form used to provide a value during an authentication process

data.name: AuthViewAction_Description
data.value: An Auth View Action is a link or button that can be clicked on an authentication view to trigger an action

data.name: AuthDSL_Help
data.value: A test scenario is exactly one step that can be performed on an authenticatlon flow it has a setup, an action and expected end-state

data.name: AuthDSL_Description
data.value: A test scenario is exactly one step that can be performed on an authenticatlon flow it has a setup, an action and expected end-state

data.name: AuthView_Route_Help
data.value: The route used to navigate to this authentication view.

data.name: AuthView_Actions_Help
data.value: The available actions a user can take on this authentication view.

data.name: AuthView_Views_Help
data.value: The fields that appear on this authentication view.

data.name: AuthViewField_Name_Help
data.value: The display name for this field.

data.name: AuthViewField_Finder_Help
data.value: The selector or lookup key used to find this field in the UI.

data.name: AuthFieldAction_Name_Help
data.value: The display name for this action.

data.name: AuthFieldAction_Finder_Help
data.value: The selector or lookup key used to find this action in the UI.

data.name: AuthViewField_Help
data.value: Defines a field displayed within an authentication view.

data.name: AuthViewField_Description
data.value: Represents a single field definition used to locate and render authentication inputs.

data.name: AuthFieldAction_Help
data.value: Defines an action that can be performed within an authentication view.

data.name: AuthFieldAction_Description
data.value: Represents a user-invokable action associated with an authentication field, including its display name and UI locator.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_Help
data.value: Defines the tenant and user state conditions used to drive authentication flow behavior.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_Description
data.value: Represents a snapshot of condition flags and provider settings used to evaluate which authentication steps and UI elements should apply.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_BelongsToOrg_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the user must belong to an organization, must not belong, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_EmailConfirmed_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the user's email must be confirmed, must not be confirmed, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_PhoneNumberConfirmed_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the user's phone number must be confirmed, must not be confirmed, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_IsLoggedIn_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the user is logged in or logged out, if not-set, we assume that the user is not logged in.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_TwoFactorEnabled_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether two-factor authentication must be enabled, must be disabled, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_IsAccountDisabled_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the account must be disabled, must be enabled, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_IsAnonymous_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the user must be anonymous, must be authenticated, or it does not matter.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_ShowWelcome_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether a welcome experience should be shown.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_ExternalLoginProviders_Help
data.value: List of external authentication providers that should be available for sign-in.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_LastMfaDateTimeUtc_Help
data.value: The most recent multi-factor authentication time in UTC, used to evaluate MFA freshness.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_EnsureUserExists_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the system must ensure a user exists before proceeding.

data.name: AuthTenantStateSnapshot_EnsureUserDoesNotExist_Help
data.value: Condition indicating whether the system must ensure a user does not exist before proceeding.

data.name: AppUserTestingDSL_AuthView_Help
data.value: The authentication view to execute as part of this test ceremony.

data.name: AppUserTestingDSL_Inputs_Help
data.value: Input values required by the runner for this ceremony (for example username, password, tokens, or return URLs).

data.name: AppUserTestingDSL_Action_Help
data.value: The action to invoke when executing the ceremony (for example Back, Next, Done, or Cancel).

data.name: AppUserTestingDSL_Preconditions_Help
data.value: Declarative conditions that should be satisfied before executing the ceremony.

data.name: AppUserTestingDSL_Expected_Help
data.value: The expected result after the ceremony completes.

data.name: AppUserTestingExpectedOutcome_Help
data.value: Defines the expected results after an authentication ceremony completes.

data.name: AppUserTestingExpectedOutcome_Description
data.value: Represents the expected landing behavior, postconditions, and audit signals used to verify successful authentication flows.

data.name: AppUserTestingExpectedOutcome_ExpectedLanding_Help
data.value: The route the user is expected to land on after the ceremony completes, once all redirects and rules are applied.

data.name: AppUserTestingExpectedOutcome_Postconditions_Help
data.value: Expected authentication and tenant state conditions that should hold after the ceremony completes.

data.name: AppUserTestingExpectedOutcome_ExpectedAuthLogEvents_Help
data.value: List of authentication log events that are expected to be emitted during or after the ceremony.

data.name: AppUserTestScenario_AuthView_Help
data.value: The authentication view that this scenario targets.

data.name: PasskeyRegistrationCompleteRequestWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format payload used to complete passkey registration, containing the challenge and attestation data.

data.name: PasskeyRegistrationCompleteRequestWire_Help
data.value: Use this model for client-to-server passkey registration completion where attestation fields are base64url strings.

data.name: PasskeyAuthenticationCompleteRequestWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format payload used to complete passkey authentication, containing the challenge and assertion data.

data.name: PasskeyAuthenticationCompleteRequestWire_Help
data.value: Use this model for client-to-server passkey authentication completion where assertion fields are base64url strings.

data.name: WebAuthnAttestationWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format WebAuthn attestation container, including identifiers and a structured response.

data.name: WebAuthnAttestationWire_Help
data.value: Represents the WebAuthn attestation object as received from the browser, using base64url strings for binary fields.

data.name: WebAuthnAttestationResponseWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format attestation response containing client data JSON and the attestation object.

data.name: WebAuthnAttestationResponseWire_Help
data.value: Contains the base64url-encoded clientDataJSON and attestationObject returned by the authenticator.

data.name: WebAuthnAssertionWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format WebAuthn assertion container, including identifiers and a structured response.

data.name: WebAuthnAssertionWire_Help
data.value: Represents the WebAuthn assertion object as received from the browser, using base64url strings for binary fields.

data.name: WebAuthnAssertionResponseWire_Description
data.value: Wire-format assertion response containing authenticator data, signature, and client data JSON.

data.name: WebAuthnAssertionResponseWire_Help
data.value: Contains base64url-encoded authenticatorData, signature, and clientDataJSON, plus an optional userHandle.

data.name: PasskeyBeginOptionsResponse_Description
data.value: Response returned from a passkey begin call, including the challenge id and WebAuthn options payload.

data.name: PasskeyBeginOptionsResponse_Help
data.value: The options field is returned as JSON to be forwarded directly to WebAuthn APIs; rpId and origin may be included for diagnostics.

data.name: PasskeyRegistrationCompleteRequest_Description
data.value: Server request model to complete passkey registration using the wire-format attestation payload.

data.name: PasskeyRegistrationCompleteRequest_Help
data.value: Use this model when completing registration; attestation fields are base64url strings matching the browser wire shape.

data.name: PasskeyAuthenticationCompleteRequest_Description
data.value: Server request model to complete passkey authentication using the wire-format assertion payload.

data.name: PasskeyAuthenticationCompleteRequest_Help
data.value: Use this model when completing authentication; assertion fields are base64url strings matching the browser wire shape.

data.name: RenamePasskeyRequest_Description
data.value: Request used to rename an existing registered passkey credential.

data.name: RenamePasskeyRequest_Help
data.value: Provide the new display name for the credential; only the name is updated.

data.name: AcceptInviteResponse_Description
data.value: Response returned after an invitation is accepted, including redirect instructions and related entity references.

data.name: AcceptInviteResponse_Help
data.value: Use this model to return post-invite acceptance details such as the original email, next page to navigate to, and associated customer/contact context.

data.name: AuthLoginRequest_Description
data.value: Request payload used to authenticate a user with email and password, optionally including invite and organization context.

data.name: AuthLoginRequest_Help
data.value: Use this model when submitting credentials for login. Supports remembering the session, invite-based onboarding, and lockout behavior on failed attempts.

data.name: AuthResponse_Description
data.value: Response returned after authentication, including access/refresh tokens, user and organization context, and role assignments.

data.name: AuthResponse_Help
data.value: Use this model to return authentication results to clients, including token lifetimes, lockout state, resolved user/org headers, and any redirect URI.

data.name: TokenAuthOptions_Description
data.value: Configuration options for token-based authentication, including expiration settings, issuer/audience values, and signing credentials.

data.name: TokenAuthOptions_Help
data.value: Use this model to configure JWT/token authentication behavior such as access/refresh lifetimes and token signing configuration.

data.name: AuthFailureRecord_Description
data.value: Structured log record describing an authorization or authentication failure for an HTTP request, including endpoint requirements and request context.

data.name: AuthFailureRecord_Help
data.value: Use this model for diagnostics and telemetry when requests fail authorization. Captures required policies/roles/schemes along with request metadata to aid troubleshooting.

data.name: CreateUserResponse_Description
data.value: Response returned after creating a user account, extending the authentication response with setup state and redirect messaging.

data.name: CreateUserResponse_Help
data.value: Use this model when provisioning a new user. Includes tokens, resolved user/org context, and onboarding setup state with optional redirect instructions.

data.name: MobileOAuthPendingAuth_Description
data.value: Temporary cached record used during mobile OAuth sign-in to correlate the deep link callback with PKCE-style challenge verification.

data.name: MobileOAuthPendingAuth_Help
data.value: Use this model to store the one-time code, state, and challenge while the OAuth browser flow completes. Supports optional binding to app instance/device and replay protection via redemption tracking.

data.name: UserLoginResponse_Description
data.value: Response returned after a user login, including the resolved user profile, favorites, recent items, redirect messaging, and authentication timing metrics.

data.name: UserLoginResponse_Help
data.value: Use this model to return the full post-login payload for the UI, including user context and diagnostic authentication metrics for performance and troubleshooting.

data.name: ChangePassword_Description
data.value: Request payload used to change a user’s password, including the current password and the new password.

data.name: ChangePassword_Help
data.value: Use this model when a user is updating their password. The old password is validated before applying the new password.

data.name: ConfirmEmail_Description
data.value: Request payload used to confirm a user’s email address using the verification code received by the client.

data.name: ConfirmEmail_Help
data.value: Use this model when completing email verification. The received code is validated and the user’s email is marked as confirmed.

data.name: InviteUser_Description
data.value: Request payload used to invite a user to an organization, including recipient details, optional message, and related customer context.

data.name: InviteUser_Help
data.value: Use this model when inviting users into an organization. Includes target org, recipient email/name, and optional end user app org and customer/customer contact references.

data.name: RegisterUser_Description
data.value: Request payload used to register a new user, including identity details, login type/source, optional app/org context, and customer information for end-user onboarding.

data.name: RegisterUser_Help
data.value: Use this model when creating new users via self-registration, OAuth, or passkey. Includes validation rules for end-user app logins requiring org/customer context and customer location fields.

data.name: RoleAccessDTO_Description
data.value: Table-storage DTO representing role-based access permissions for a module area/page/feature and CRUD operations, with conversion to the domain RoleAccess model.

data.name: RoleAccessDTO_Help
data.value: Use this model for persistence and transport of role access mappings. Convert to RoleAccess via ToRoleAccess() to get strongly-typed EntityHeader references and permission flags.

data.name: SendResetPasswordLink_Description
data.value: Request payload used to send a password reset link to the specified email address.

data.name: SendResetPasswordLink_Help
data.value: Use this model to initiate a password reset flow. The server will generate a reset token and deliver a reset link to the user’s email.

data.name: UserRoleDTO_Description
data.value: Table-storage DTO representing a user-to-role assignment within an organization, with conversion to the UserRole domain model.

data.name: UserRoleDTO_Help
data.value: Use this model for persistence and transport of user role assignments. Convert to UserRole via ToUserRole() to get strongly-typed EntityHeader references.

data.name: VerfiyPhoneNumber_Description
data.value: Request payload used to verify a phone number using an SMS verification code, with an option to skip the step.

data.name: VerfiyPhoneNumber_Help
data.value: Use this model when confirming a user’s phone number. Provide the SMS code and phone number, or set SkipStep to bypass verification when allowed.

data.name: LocationDevice_Description
data.value: Associates a device repository and a specific device to a location context.

data.name: LocationDevice_Help
data.value: Use this model to select a device repository and device when configuring devices at a location. The device field is constrained via the repository selection.

data.name: TeamUser_Description
data.value: Table-storage entity representing membership of a user in a team, including audit fields and optional profile image information.

data.name: TeamUser_Help
data.value: Use this model to persist and manage team membership. RowKey is generated as "{teamId}.{userId}" and CreateSummary() can be used to produce a lightweight TeamUserSummary for UI lists.

data.name: TeamUserSummary_Description
data.value: Lightweight summary view of a team user, including profile image information.

data.name: TeamUserSummary_Help
data.value: Use this model when returning a compact representation of a team user for list views or lookups.

data.name: BasicTheme_Description
data.value: Simple theme configuration defining primary background, primary text, and accent colors.

data.name: BasicTheme_Help
data.value: Use this model to capture basic UI theme color settings for an organization or application experience.

data.name: CallLog_Description
data.value: Represents a phone call log entry, including caller/callee details, timestamp, duration, and an optional recording URL.

data.name: CallLog_Help
data.value: Use this model to store or return call history details for auditing and support, including who called whom, when, how long the call lasted, and any recording reference.

data.name: PasskeyChallenge_Description
data.value: Represents a server-generated passkey (WebAuthn) challenge record, including RP/origin context, allowed credentials, options parameters, and expiration tracking.

data.name: PasskeyChallenge_Help
data.value: Use this model to persist the active passkey registration/authentication challenge. It includes the challenge value, purpose, optional allow/exclude credential lists, and expiry logic used to validate completion requests.

data.name: PasskeyChallengePacket_Description
data.value: Packet containing a PasskeyChallenge plus the serialized WebAuthn options JSON payload used for client initiation.

data.name: PasskeyChallengePacket_Help
data.value: Use this model to return both the server challenge record and the raw WebAuthn options JSON to the client so it can call WebAuthn APIs while the server remains authoritative.

data.name: PasskeyCredential_Description
data.value: Represents a registered passkey credential for a user, including credential id, public key material, sign count, display name, and usage timestamps.

data.name: PasskeyCredential_Help
data.value: Use this model to store and manage passkey credentials associated with a user and RP ID. CredentialId and PublicKey are stored as base64url strings and SignCount is used for WebAuthn replay protection.

data.name: PasskeyCredentialIndex_Description
data.value: Index record used to lookup a passkey credential by user, RP ID, and credential id, including creation timestamp.

data.name: PasskeyCredentialIndex_Help
data.value: Use this model as a lightweight index for locating stored passkey credentials. It supports efficient queries by user, RP ID, and credential id without loading full credential details.

data.name: PasskeySignInResult_Description
data.value: Result returned after passkey authentication, including the authenticated user context and optional onboarding/redirect instructions.

data.name: PasskeySignInResult_Help
data.value: Use this model to return the outcome of passkey sign-in. Indicates whether onboarding is still required and provides optional redirect URL and UI message for the client.

data.name: PasskeyCredentialSummary_Description
data.value: Lightweight summary of a registered passkey credential including identifier, display name, and key timestamps.

data.name: PasskeyCredentialSummary_Help
data.value: Use this model when returning a list of a user’s registered passkeys without exposing full credential details such as public key material.

data.name: AccessLog_Description
data.value: Table-storage entity used to record access activity for a resource, including organization/user context, action details, and authorization outcome.

data.name: AccessLog_Help
data.value: Use this model to capture auditing and diagnostic information when users access protected resources. Includes action, details, whether access was authorized, and an optional reason when not authorized.

data.name: ManagedAsset_Description
data.value: Table-storage entity representing an asset managed within an asset set, including asset identifiers, type, and helper methods for row key generation.

data.name: ManagedAsset_Help
data.value: Use this model to persist managed assets associated with an asset set. RowKey is generated as "{assetSetId}.{assetId}" and CreateSummary() provides a lightweight ManagedAssetSummary for list views.

data.name: ManagedAssetSummary_Description
data.value: Lightweight summary view of a managed asset, including id, name, and asset type.

data.name: ManagedAssetSummary_Help
data.value: Use this model when returning a compact representation of managed assets for UI list displays or lookups.

data.name: RoleAccess_Description
data.value: Defines role-based access permissions for modules/areas/pages/features, including CRUD levels and optional function map bindings.

data.name: RoleAccess_Help
data.value: Use this model to represent and compute permissions granted by a role. Supports conversion to RoleAccessDTO for storage and merging into UserAccess for effective permission evaluation.

data.name: SecureLink_Description
data.value: Table-storage entity representing a time-limited secure link for a user within an organization, including creator info, destination, expiration, and access tracking.

data.name: SecureLink_Help
data.value: Use this model to issue and track secure links (e.g., invite or action links). Captures org/user context, generator, expiration status, and access count/last access for auditing.

data.name: TwitterErrorResponse_Description
data.value: Represents an error response returned from Twitter APIs, containing one or more TwitterError entries.

data.name: TwitterErrorResponse_Help
data.value: Use this model to deserialize and inspect error responses from Twitter API calls. The Errors collection contains the error code and message details.

data.name: TwitterError_Description
data.value: Represents a single Twitter API error including code and message.

data.name: TwitterError_Help
data.value: Use this model to capture individual error details returned from Twitter APIs for diagnostics and user messaging.

data.name: TwitterRequestToken_Description
data.value: Represents a Twitter OAuth request token response, including token secret and callback confirmation flag.

data.name: TwitterRequestToken_Help
data.value: Use this model for Twitter OAuth flows when exchanging for a request token. Includes the token, token secret, and whether callback was confirmed.

data.name: TwitterAccessToken_Description
data.value: Represents a Twitter OAuth access token response, extending request token data with user identity fields.

data.name: TwitterAccessToken_Help
data.value: Use this model when exchanging a Twitter request token for an access token. Includes token details plus the authenticated Twitter user id and screen name.

data.name: UserAccess_Description
data.value: Represents effective CRUD access levels for a user, using grant/revoke/not-specified values and helper methods for common access configurations.

data.name: UserAccess_Help
data.value: Use this model to compute and convey effective user permissions. Supports generating full access, none, or not-specified states and can revoke unset permissions via RevokeNotSet().

data.name: AppUserTestRun_Description
data.value: Persisted record of a single test run execution, including environment details, lifecycle timestamps, status, verification results, events, and generated artifacts.

data.name: AppUserTestRun_Help
data.value: Use this model to store and review a test run end-to-end. Includes a support-friendly RunCode, base URL and paths/views, status/error, final verification snapshot, append-only events, and output artifacts.

data.name: AppUserTestRunSummary_Description
data.value: Lightweight summary representation of an AppUserTestRun for list views and quick lookup.

data.name: AppUserTestRunSummary_Help
data.value: Use this model when returning compact test run data for grids, searches, or pickers where full run details are not required.

data.name: TestRunVerification_Description
data.value: Final verification payloads for a test run, including the final tenant state snapshot, computed landing/configuration values, auth log review summary, and any errors or warnings.

data.name: TestRunVerification_Help
data.value: Use this model to capture and return verification results after execution. Includes computed expectations, auth log review details, and categorized error/warning lists.

data.name: TestRunArtifact_Description
data.value: Represents an artifact produced by a test run, such as logs, screenshots, traces, or exported files, including file name and location information.

data.name: TestRunArtifact_Help
data.value: Use this model to link test output files to a run. Includes display name, file name, URL, and optional relative path for storage organization.

data.name: AuthLogReviewSummary_Description
data.value: Summary of an authentication log review for a time window, including expected events that were missing and the observed events that occurred.

data.name: AuthLogReviewSummary_Help
data.value: Use this model to compare expected vs observed auth events during a test run, bounded by FromUtc and ToUtc.

data.name: AppUserTestRunEvent_Description
data.value: Append-only structured event emitted during a test run, including sequence ordering, timestamp, severity level, event type, message, and structured key/value data.

data.name: AppUserTestRunEvent_Help
data.value: Use this model for time-ordered execution telemetry. Seq should be assigned by persistence to enforce ordering and Data should remain JSON-friendly primitives/strings.

data.name: AuthRunnerPlan_Description
data.value: Execution plan describing what the auth runner needs to perform a single ceremony run, including scenario, navigation start, inputs, one action, observation hints, and execution options.

data.name: AuthRunnerPlan_Help
data.value: Use this model to instruct the runner what to do for a single run. The runner executes and reports observations; server-side logic determines pass/fail using snapshots and logs.

data.name: TestUserCredentials_Description
data.value: Credential and token inputs used by the auth runner for a test user, including invite and email confirmation tokens and optional passkey credentials reference.

data.name: TestUserCredentials_Help
data.value: Use this model to provide the runner with the identity inputs needed for a scenario, such as email/password, invite id, confirm email token, and optional passkey credentials id.

data.name: AuthRunnerInput_Description
data.value: Single input assignment for the runner, describing a named field, CSS selector finder, value to set, and optional input kind.

data.name: AuthRunnerInput_Help
data.value: Use this model to tell the runner how to populate a UI field before invoking an action. Finder should be a Playwright-compatible CSS selector and Kind can hint how to apply the value.

data.name: AuthRunnerAction_Description
data.value: Single action for the runner to invoke, describing a named action and the CSS selector to click or submit.

data.name: AuthRunnerAction_Help
data.value: Use this model to specify exactly one UI action (click/submit) the runner should perform. Finder should be a Playwright-compatible CSS selector.

data.name: AuthRunnerObservations_Description
data.value: Hints for what evidence the runner should capture and report, including screen root selector, screen id attribute, expected end view/route, and optional busy-state selector.

data.name: AuthRunnerObservations_Help
data.value: Use this model to guide runner evidence capture. These values are observation hints only; mismatches are logged as notes and server logic decides pass/fail.

data.name: AuthRunnerOptions_Description
data.value: Execution options controlling runner behavior such as headless mode, slow motion timing, default timeouts, and optional tracing.

data.name: AuthRunnerOptions_Help
data.value: Use this model to tune runner execution for debugging and reliability. EnableTracing can be used to collect Playwright traces and upload them as artifacts.

data.name: AuthRunnerResult_Description
data.value: Result posted back by the runner after execution, including run timing, status, final URL/view, notes, and artifact references.

data.name: AuthRunnerResult_Help
data.value: Use this model to return runner observations to the server. The server combines these with snapshots and auth log checks to determine pass/fail.

data.name: AuthRunnerArtifact_Description
data.value: Reference to an artifact produced by the runner, such as traces, screenshots, or video, including name, kind, and reference location.

data.name: AuthRunnerArtifact_Help
data.value: Use this model to attach runner-produced evidence to a run result. Ref can be a URL or server-side id pointing to stored artifacts.

data.name: AppUserInboxItem_Description
data.value: Table-storage entity representing a user-scoped inbox item/notification, including display metadata, link target, viewed state, and audit fields.

data.name: AppUserInboxItem_Help
data.value: Use this model to persist and deliver inbox items to users. Includes title/summary/icon/link, type, viewed tracking, and conversion to an InboxItem via ToInboxItem().

data.name: NewAppUserInboxItemItem_Description
data.value: Input model used to create a new AppUserInboxItem for a user in an organization, including creator context and the display/link metadata.

data.name: NewAppUserInboxItemItem_Help
data.value: Use this model when composing a new user inbox item. CreateInboxItem() generates a properly keyed AppUserInboxItem with audit fields and timestamps set.

data.name: CoreUserInfo_Description
data.value: Core profile information for a user, including identity fields, contact details, address, timezone, and optional signature and secure SSN field linkage.

data.name: CoreUserInfo_Help
data.value: Use this model to capture and edit the essential user profile fields used across the system. Includes FormField metadata for UI rendering and supports secure SSN storage via SsnSecretId.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsed_Description
data.value: Represents a user’s most recently used items across the application, including an overall list and module-scoped groupings.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsed_Help
data.value: Use this model to store and return MRU navigation and entity references for a user. Includes both a global list and per-module collections and provides stable id generation by org/user.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsedModule_Description
data.value: Module-scoped grouping of most recently used items, keyed by module and containing an ordered item list.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsedModule_Help
data.value: Use this model to group MRU items by module for faster UI rendering and navigation. Items are represented as MostRecentlyUsedItem entries.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsedItem_Description
data.value: Single most recently used entry including identity, module key, timestamps, route, display metadata, and navigation link.

data.name: MostRecentlyUsedItem_Help
data.value: Use this model to represent an MRU entry shown in recent lists. Includes routing/navigation info plus optional name, summary, icon, and link for UI display.

data.name: NotificationContact_Description
data.value: Notification contact details for an app user, including email, phone, and configured push notification channels.

data.name: NotificationContact_Help
data.value: Use this model to represent who notifications should be delivered to for a user. Includes basic contact fields and the list of enabled push notification channels.

data.name: PaymentAccounts_Description
data.value: Represents one or more payment and routing account pairs used for payment processing configuration.

data.name: PaymentAccounts_Help
data.value: Use this model to store configured payment account numbers and routing numbers (up to two sets) for billing or payment disbursement scenarios.

data.name: PendingIdentity_Description
data.value: Provisional authentication container used to resolve an identity and complete create/link flows before a durable user account exists, including untrusted profile data, verification state, and exactly one populated auth bucket.

data.name: PendingIdentity_Help
data.value: Use this model as an “airlock” for sign-up and external login flows. It is authenticated for finalize/link operations only (no app authorization). Exactly one auth bucket should be populated based on FlowType and invite context can be attached when applicable.

data.name: PushNotificationChannel_Description
data.value: Represents a push notification channel registration for a device/user, including token, platform, and creation timestamp.

data.name: PushNotificationChannel_Help
data.value: Use this model to store device push notification registrations. The Token is the platform push token and Platform indicates the originating device platform.

data.name: SingleUseToken_Description
data.value: Represents a short-lived single-use token issued for a user, including the token value and expiration timestamp.

data.name: SingleUseToken_Help
data.value: Use this model to store or transmit one-time tokens for user actions such as secure links or verification steps. Tokens should be validated once and rejected after expiry.

data.name: UserRole_Description
data.value: Represents an assignment of a role to a user within an organization, including creation metadata and conversion to a storage DTO.

data.name: UserRole_Help
data.value: Use this model to represent user-to-role membership. Supports conversion to UserRoleDTO for persistence and exposes the Role as an EntityHeader for UI selection and security checks.

data.name: UserFavorites_Description
data.value: Represents a user’s favorite items across the application, including a global favorites list and favorites grouped by module.

data.name: UserFavorites_Help
data.value: Use this model to store and return favorite navigation/entity references for a user. Includes both a global list and per-module collections and provides stable id generation by org/user.

data.name: FavoritesByModule_Description
data.value: Module-scoped grouping of user favorites, keyed by module and containing an item list of UserFavorite entries.

data.name: FavoritesByModule_Help
data.value: Use this model to group favorites by module for UI navigation and rendering. Items are represented as UserFavorite entries.

data.name: UserFavorite_Description
data.value: Represents a single favorite entry including identity, module key, timestamps, route, and UI display/navigation metadata.

data.name: UserFavorite_Help
data.value: Use this model to represent a favorite item shown in favorites lists. Includes routing/navigation info plus optional name, summary, icon, and link for UI display.

data.name: KioskLoginViewModel_Description
data.value: View model containing kiosk authentication inputs including client id and API key.

data.name: KioskLoginViewModel_Help
data.value: Use this model when submitting kiosk login credentials. ClientId identifies the kiosk client and ApiKey provides the shared secret for authentication.

data.name: MagicLinkAttempt_Help
data.value: Represents a single, time-limited magic link sign-in attempt used to authenticate an existing user without a password.

data.name: MagicLinkAttempt_Description
data.value: A Magic Link Attempt captures the lifecycle of a passwordless sign-in request, including issuance, expiration, and single-use consumption. It supports both portal-based cookie authentication and mobile exchange-code flows that mint JWTs, and always defers navigation decisions to the standard post-login routing logic.

data.name: MagicLinkRequest_Help
data.value: Represents a request to send a magic sign-in link to an email address.

data.name: MagicLinkRequest_Description
data.value: Contains the information required to request a sign-in-only magic link, including the target email address, client channel, and optional return URL.

data.name: MagicLinkRequestContext_Help
data.value: Provides request-level context for a magic link sign-in request.

data.name: MagicLinkRequestContext_Description
data.value: Captures contextual metadata such as IP address, user agent, and correlation identifier used for auditing and abuse detection.

data.name: MagicLinkConsumeContext_Help
data.value: Provides request context when consuming a magic sign-in link.

data.name: MagicLinkConsumeContext_Description
data.value: Contains client channel and request metadata used when validating and consuming a magic sign-in link.

data.name: MagicLinkConsumeResponse_Help
data.value: Represents the result of consuming a magic sign-in link.

data.name: MagicLinkConsumeResponse_Description
data.value: Contains the consumed magic link attempt and, for mobile clients, a short-lived exchange code used to obtain a JWT.

data.name: MagicLinkExchangeContext_Help
data.value: Provides request context for exchanging a magic link exchange code.

data.name: MagicLinkExchangeContext_Description
data.value: Captures metadata used when validating and consuming a magic link exchange code prior to JWT issuance.

data.name: MagicLinkExchangeResponse_Help
data.value: Represents the result of exchanging a magic link exchange code.

data.name: MagicLinkExchangeResponse_Description
data.value: Contains the resolved user identity and associated magic link attempt after successful exchange, enabling JWT issuance by the authentication system.
